ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Better close reading skills, knowledge of tragedies, how to read a play instead of a novel
I developed the ability to analyze deeply plays to understand implied themes and intentions of the authors.

I gained valuable knowledge about European plays, the meaning of tragedy, and how to read plays as literature. I think I've come away with a better grasp on how to draw parallels and compare literature since we worked within a tradition with a large body of work.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: great selection of works, manageable assignments 
Weakness: sometimes went too fast through the plays, pace was a bit rushed
It would be very interesting to take this class in person. I'm sure the acting and group readings would be even more engaging.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Plays were amazing, connected well to each other. Professor Trumpener is great.
Yes. This class is engaging and works with interesting tragedies. Not a typical English class.
I would definitely recommend ENGL 129 to another student. It is a highly organized course and Professor Trumpener is fantastic.

Yes, I would recommend this course to another student. I read so many things I enjoyed and had never been exposed to before and felt safe to express my thoughts and opinions. Professor Trumpener is so intelligent and generous and funny. This course was a highlight to my semester, even though it had to be online.
